title: Found in a box of old stuff.
content:
I was just curious if anyone knew any information on this font. I was just sorting some old papers and found this clipping. Any info would be great.

Thanks very much.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203036im_/http:/typophile.com/files/unknown_type_5017.gif)

 [‹ ID - asymmetrical A's & M's?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203036/http:/typophile.com/node/49712 "Go to previous forum topic") [What is this modified font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203036/http:/typophile.com/node/49727 "Go to next forum topic")
author: crmoberg

comments.content: Very nice! It looks like something that should join the House Industries Las Vegas collection.
Do You know the name of this font or if I could recreate it at all. Under the original name of course.
This looks like it was a pattern for making letters, not a font. Notice how they provided a grid to make it easier for people to redraw the letters at a different size.
House Industries’ [Trickhouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203036/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=25&subpage=viewfontspecimens) (Street Van Fonts) is similar as well.
